In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is one way to implement the `add_yearmonth` function in Julia:
```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[!, :ym] = string.(year.(df[:dt]), lpad.(month.(df[:dt]), 2, '0'))
end
```

This creates a new column `ym` in the DataFrame `df` by extracting the year and month from the `dt` column using the `year` and `month` functions respectively. The `lpad` function is used to left-pad the month numbers with a leading zero if they are single digits. Finally, the `string` function is used to concatenate the year and month together as a string in the format "yyyymm".
You can then call this function on your DataFrame like so:
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```

And you will have a new column `ym` in your dataframe with the year-month concatenation.
